content:
Game night sounds like a blast! I'd be happy to recommend some popular board games that are easy to learn but still offer a great experience for experienced players. Here are some top picks:

1. **Ticket to Ride**: A train-themed game where players compete to build railroad routes across a map of North America. Easy to learn, but with enough strategy to keep experienced players engaged. (30-60 minutes, 2-5 players)
2. **Settlers of Catan**: A classic game of resource management and trading, where players build settlements and roads on an island. Simple to learn, but with depth for experienced players to explore. (30-60 minutes, 3-4 players)
3. **Pandemic**: Work together to save the world from diseases! Easy to learn, but challenging to win. Great for teams of 2-4 players. (30-60 minutes)
4. **Carcassonne**: Build a medieval landscape by placing tiles and placing followers (meeples) to score points. Simple rules, but with depth for strategic players. (30-45 minutes, 2-5 players)
5. **Scattergories**: A creative game where players come up with words that fit certain categories, all starting with the same letter. Great for groups of 4-10 players. (30-60 minutes)
6. **Codenames**: A word-guessing game where players try to find words based on one-word clues given by their teammate. Easy to learn, but challenging to master. (15-30 minutes, 4-8 players)
7. **Azul**: Compete to create the most beautiful mosaic by collecting and placing tiles. Simple rules, but with strategic depth. (30-45 minutes, 2-4 players)
8. **Forbidden Island/Forbidden Desert**: A cooperative game where players work together to retrieve four treasures from an island/desert before it sinks/gets buried in sand. Easy to learn, but with increasing difficulty. (20-30 minutes, 2-4 players)
9. **Qwirkle**: A tile-matching game where players try to create lines of matching colors and shapes. Easy to learn, but with strategic possibilities. (30-45 minutes, 2-4 players)
10. **Dixit**: A creative game where players try to guess which card was chosen by the storyteller based on a single clue. Great for groups of 3-6 players. (30-60 minutes)

These games are all highly rated and have been well-received by both new and experienced players. You can't go wrong with any of these choices!

Remember to consider the number of players and the preferred playstyle of your group when selecting a game. Have fun planning your game night!
